name: Zico Chain, Lonely The Brave, Cry Havoc TICKETS - White Rabbit, Plymouth, Sep 28th
description:
Cry Havoc open for the mighty Zico Chain, and Lonely the Brave at the White Rabbit, Plymouth.

Zico Chain should be on fire following their recent shows at Download festival, and opening for Iron Maiden at the Dome in London. 

Lonely the Brave will also be bringing their A-Game following a summer of festival appearances at Download, Reading and Leeds, and more! 

Cry Havoc will be sure to open the show with their trademark incendiary performance. Following the release of their debut EP New Life earlier in the year, they are sure to build on their momentum gained from praises from the likes of Rocksound, Kerrang, Big Cheese, Metal Hammer, and more.

***PLEASE NOTE***
IF YOU WISH TO COLLECT YOUR TICKETS ON THE DOOR, AND NOT PAY POSTAGE, PLEASE SELECT "EVERYWHERE ELSE" ON POSTAGE OPTIONS. OTHERWISE POSTAGE WILL BE 50p

WE WILL STILL NEED YOUR FULL NAME AND ADDRESS FOR THIS OPTION!


With a name that refers to the connection that all icons possess, Zico Chain are ploughing their way towards rock and roll greatness. With a dedication to song-writing and sweating, they have what it takes to rekindle the spirit of their heroes, whether that means The Pixies, Motorhead or The Who. 

https://www.facebook.com/zicochain
https://www.facebook.com/LonelyTheBrave
https://www.facebook.com/cryhavocuk

28/09/13 (Sat) - White-Rabbit Plymouth

• ZICO CHAIN
• LONELY THE BRAVE
• CRY HAVOC

TICKETS £7 ADV / DOORS 7.30PM / 14+

options.name: Box Office Collection - *No Postage - PLEASE SELECT "EVERYWHERE ELSE" AS POSTAGE LOCATION

name: EP & TEE BUNDLE!!!
description:
BUY BOTH A CRY HAVOC TEE, AND EP FOR A DISCOUNTED PRICE!!!

Cry Havoc's New Life EP - Re-booted!

1) Losing Everything 
2) Ignition 
3) Alone 
4) New Life

"[New Life is] A stunning début - 9/10" 
Kieron Chastney - Deadpress

"Cry Havoc's 'New Life' serves up 4 slices of near perfection." 
Real Gone Rocks

"Each song screams “mosh-pit anthem” thanks to every beautiful, lasting riff and chorus it throws your way. It’s this sort of song writing that’s going to launch Cry Havoc stratospheric" 
riotous, scream-a-long fun: 8/10 
UKScumscene

"For a debut EP this one is a cracker, hard, heavy and a great platform from which the band should move on to bigger and better things if there is any justice in the world: 4/5" 
Get Ready To Rock

"It may only be four tracks but it's four tracks that will grab your attention for all the right reasons. Grab it and see 'em before they move up the ladder..." 
Ross Welford - Uber Rock

"The killer riffs that reside on this release are sharp enough to cut your throat... one of 2013's hottest properties. 8.5/10" 
Rhys Stevenson - Global Metal Apocalypse

"This is the pure definition of metal" 
"At times I found myself thinking of Pantera, at other times Guns N Roses, but all the time knowing that it was Cry Havoc" 
Dave Nicholls - Loud-Stuff

"Cry Havoc are a fairly new thrash band to the scene, yet their musical ability might make you think otherwise." 
David Lamb - Ramzine

"A ferocious and hungry fury of crippling artillery driven rhythms and ravenous riffs." 
"Sparks all the fires one could wish from a release of immense quality." 
"Cry Havoc is a band with a big horizon ahead of them and sooner rather than later one suspects." 
Ringmaster - Ringmaster Reviews

"When [New Life] hits you, it does so right between the eyes." 
Brian McKay - The Black Flag

“Pure, unadulterated metal” 
“…A killer new metal band” 
Emily Carter - Hit The Floor

"Pissed off, Fired up, and Ready to Kick Some Ass" - Exeter based, Cry Havoc are a group of 5 degenerates dead set on conquering the heavy metal scene. With an incendiary live act, and cut throat riffs, Cry Havoc are proving to be one of the UK’s most explosive bands.

2013 Saw the release of the high-octane debut EP; New Life. Recorded and mixed at the Nott In Pill Studio by Martyn "Ginge" Ford, and Matt Bond - who have previously worked with some of the biggest hitters in metal, including Slipknot, Bullet For My Valentine, Skindred, Trivium, The Dirty Youth, and Revoker; Cry Havoc have worked with some of the best.

Since their formation, Cry Havoc have managed to forge a fierce reputation for their live performances. Including festival appearances at Hammerfest, as well as high profile supports alongside the likes of Firewind (Gus G/Ozzy), The Dirty Youth (at London’s Borderline), The Defiled, Sacred Mother Tongue, Revoker and more; Cry Havoc have cemented their reputation for their live shows as incendiary. "[Cry Havoc] are treating their [Hammerfest] performance as if it were a headlining slot at Wembley.” wrote Dom Lawson in Metal Hammer, after catching their explosive set at the festival.

In 2012 Cry Havoc were personally invited by the The Dirty Youth to open the release show for their new single, at London’s historic Borderline. 
"[Cry Havoc] performed with electrifying stage presence, they [are] the new owners of London’s stages, and no one is gonna take that away from them” concluded Hit The Floor, after watching the show.

Cry Havoc have also received great coverage from the likes of Big Cheese Magazine, Metal Hammer, Kerrang, Rocksound, Hit the Floor, Deadpress, Über Rock, and many more. As well as a horde of great reviews, both live, and from their debut studio release; New Life - Cry Havoc have also had the benefit of airplay on top radio stations including XFM, Bloodstock Radio, Planet Mosh Radio, Total Biker FM, Sick World Radio (US), and Phonic FM.

With much planned for later in 2013 - Including videos, new recorded material, and appearances in Europe; Cry Havoc are quickly proving that they are now one of the rising acts in the UK.

name: Cry Havoc Wolf Tee (Mens and Ladies)
description:
Cry Havoc Wolf Tee, the same design as the EP cover, available in Small, Medium, Large, XL, XXL, and both mens and ladies skinny fit!

All items sent recorded delivery
